data.name: Mixing integer types - Part 1
data.description:
Rust contains a rather strict type system compared to most languages and requires developers to be specific and explicit about their intentions when performing operations which mix different types.

This kata explores how this works in practice by having the developer implement multiple functions concerning adding integers of mixed widths and signedness. In addition to simply converting types, you will also need to consider the possibilty of over/underflow in some cases.

Useful References:
- [Rust Manual - Integer Types](https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/ch03-02-data-types.html#integer-types)
- [Rust Manual - Integer Overflow](https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/ch03-02-data-types.html#integer-overflow)
- [Rust by Example - Casting](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rust-by-example/types/cast.html)
- [Standard Library Docs - u8](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.u8.html#) (links are for u8 primitive, but similar docs exists for other integer types)
  - [wrapping_add()](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.u8.html#method.wrapping_add)
